intro: Nemophila parviflora var. typica, commonly known as the small-flower blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, showy blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white, fuzzy hair. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and meadow habitats.
